result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Sheldon D Rock in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Sheldon D Rock.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defense waiting on records from the DA. Asking for 60 days. State does not object.
Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Letter requesting return of $500 of bond posted. "BTC: the bond Ms Kasprzak posted may be returned to her since there was double bond posted." 9-8-2022.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:00 PM (64-06) Defendant Sheldon D Rock in court.  Attorney Caleb Tomaszewski in court for Sheldon D Rock.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Tomaszewski acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy reserved.

Victim in court, had issues with police reports.
Attorney Tomaszewski is requesting to be removed from the case as attorney of record. Attorney Venema will be taking over.

Adj. 2:03PM
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Keith K. Venema
Signed bond filed with the court.
See cash bond set 8-9-2022.

Defendant Sheldon D Rock in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State. Attorney Josh Ryan for defendant. Victim is present and makes statement. Victim is asking for contact. Total bond set. Minutes filed.

Request for Return of $500 to Bond Poster

*AMENDED 8-15-22: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH C.R.K. dob 3-19-1966. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.R.K. dob 3-19-1966. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
